fields.title: Somalia: Cholera outbreak Jubaland and Southwest Week 1-14 (13.04.2023) [presentation]
fields.body:
**Highlights: Jubaland and South west**

- Overall, in Jubaland, AWD cases show a steeper increase this week compared to previous weeks.
- There has been a steep increase in cases in week 14 in Bellet Hawa, while reporting of cases in Afmadow has decreased.
- Outside of Kismayo, there is still little testing being performed to AWD cases at CTCs.
- In the newly reported cases in Bellet Hawa in week 14, there is a higher proportion of children between 0-5 years old than in previous weeks.

**Response & coordination**
- State-level cholera task force coordination (WASH/UNICEF, Health/WHO) – bi weekly TWG meetings
- Trocaire in the area with a strong operational response and capacity
- WHO has sent supplies to most locations at risk in Jubalans
- Intensified national-level coordination WHO and UNICEF – finalizing document with task distribution and deliverables

  • Outside of Kismayo, there is still little testing being performed to AWD cases at CTCs.
  • In the newly reported cases in Bellet Hawa in week 14, there is a higher proportion of children between 0-5 years old than in previous weeks.

  • State-level cholera task force coordination (WASH/UNICEF, Health/WHO) – bi weekly TWG meetings
  • Trocaire in the area with a strong operational response and capacity

text:
# Somalia: Cholera outbreak Jubaland and Southwest Week 1-14 (13.04.2023) [presentation]

**Highlights: Jubaland and South west**

- Overall, in Jubaland, AWD cases show a steeper increase this week compared to previous weeks.
- There has been a steep increase in cases in week 14 in Bellet Hawa, while reporting of cases in Afmadow has decreased.
- Outside of Kismayo, there is still little testing being performed to AWD cases at CTCs.
- In the newly reported cases in Bellet Hawa in week 14, there is a higher proportion of children between 0-5 years old than in previous weeks.

**Response & coordination**
- State-level cholera task force coordination (WASH/UNICEF, Health/WHO) – bi weekly TWG meetings
- Trocaire in the area with a strong operational response and capacity
- WHO has sent supplies to most locations at risk in Jubalans
- Intensified national-level coordination WHO and UNICEF – finalizing document with task distribution and deliverables
summary: This presentation highlights the increasing cases of AWD in Jubaland and Southwest Somalia, with a particular focus on Bellet Hawa in week 14. Response and coordination efforts include bi-weekly TWG meetings, Trocaire's operational response, WHO's supply of materials to at-risk locations, and intensified national-level coordination between WHO and UNICEF.

metadata.name: Somalia: Cholera outbreak Jubaland and Southwest Week 1-14 (13.04.2023) [presentation]
